contents.description:
Thank you for the opportunity to introduce myself.


My name is Vivek Kumar Maurya, and I‚Äôm a Frontend Developer with around 6 years of experience, primarily working on Angular, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, SCSS, and RxJS.


In my current role, I work extensively on building scalable web applications using Angular with standalone components and NgRx for state management. I handle end-to-end development, including requirement analysis, UI implementation, API integration, and performance optimization.


I also collaborate closely with backend teams and clients to ensure smooth project delivery. Over the years, I‚Äôve gained strong expertise in Angular best practices, code optimization, and maintaining clean, reusable architecture.


I‚Äôm passionate about writing efficient, maintainable code and staying updated with the latest Angular releases.

Currently, I‚Äôm looking for a role where I can contribute my frontend expertise, mentor junior developers, and work on challenging projects that push my technical boundaries.

contents.text: May I know the reason for the gaps in your employment?
contents.description: There are a 7-months gap in my employement due to some family medical responsibilities which are now fully resolved. I am ready to fully focus on my career.

In my second company, I worked on a Company Management System that handled third-party vendors and partners. The system enabled secure information exchange, task assignment with tracking, and role-based access control for data privacy.

In my last project, I worked as an Angular Developer, and my primary role was to design, develop, and maintain front-end modules using Angular 15+ with standalone components and NgRx for state management.


üîπ Key Responsibilities:

  1. Developed reusable components and implemented responsive UI using Angular, HTML, SCSS, and TypeScript.
  2. Integrated RESTful APIs and handled all CRUD operations, error handling, and response mapping.
  3. Implemented authentication (Authentication is the process of verifying the user‚Äôs identity) and authorization (Authorization defines what resources or features a user can access after they are authenticated.) using route guards, interceptors, and JWT tokens.
  4. Worked on NgRx for centralized state management ‚Äî managing actions, reducers, selectors, and effects.
  5. Used RxJS operators effectively and ensured proper unsubscription to avoid memory leaks.
  6. Optimized app performance using lazy loading, onPush change detection, and trackBy in loops.
  7. Collaborated with backend developers and QA teams to analyze requirements, debug issues, and deliver high-quality features.
  8. Participated in code reviews, provided constructive feedback, and followed best practices and coding standards.
  9. Used Git for version control and worked in an Agile environment with daily stand-ups and sprint planning.
  10. Contributed to UI/UX improvements based on client feedback and usability testing.
contents.text: What is role and responsibility in project?

contents.description:
When I do a code review, I follow a structured and collaborative process to ensure code quality, maintainability, and consistency.


üß© 1. Understand the Context: I make sure I understand what problem the code is solving and the expected outcome before reviewing the changes.


üîç 2. Review Code Structure and Readability: I check if the code is clean, modular, and easy to read.

I also ensure that naming conventions, indentation, and file organization follow project standards.


üß† 3. Check Functionality and Logic: I go through the logic step-by-step to ensure it works as intended.

I validate edge cases, error handling, and boundary conditions to make sure the implementation is robust.


‚ö° 4. Performance and Optimization:

I review the code to ensure that:

  • Signals are used effectively (if applicable).
  • Lazy loading is implemented where suitable.
  • trackBy is used in *ngFor loops to improve performance.
  • Observables are unsubscribed when necessary to prevent memory leaks.
contents.text: What steps do you follow for a code review?

name: State, State Management

contents.description:
State refers to the data or information that your application stores at a given moment and uses to determine how the UI should look or behave.


üîπ Examples of State

1. Logged-in user information

2. Form inputs

3. List of employees retrieved from API

4. UI flags (like isLoading, showModal, etc.)

5. Cart items in an e-commerce app


State management is the process of handling, updating, storing, and synchronizing this state across different parts of your application.

It ensures:

1. Data remains consistent

2. Multiple components using the same data stay in sync

3. UI updates correctly when the state changes

4. Application remains predictable and easier to debug
